Package fi.tuni.tiko

Class GlobalElements

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
fi.tuni.tiko.GlobalElements
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Cullable
public class GlobalElements
extends com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
The GlobalElements group hold all elements needed in all screens of the game. The elements are added to each screen as they become active.

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • FADE_TIME

      public final float FADE_TIME
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • GlobalElements

      public GlobalElements()
      Creates all global elements. Indicators for different emotions are created. These are used when reading from a file. Astonishment is specified on it's own because the properties file doesn't know Ã„. Initially hidden elements are added to a list and made invisible briefly at first as the game loads.

  • Method Details

    • hideBackgroundElementsWhileLoading

      public void hideBackgroundElementsWhileLoading()
      Elements in the initially hidden elements list are made invisible and returned to visible 0.1 seconds later. This is to avoid blinking over the other elements for a few frames when first loading.

    • getMeters

      public com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group getMeters()
      Returns all of the feeling meters as a group.
      Returns:
      group of feeling meters

    • createMeters

      public com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group createMeters()
      Creates a feeling meter for each of the seven emotions. The meters are hidden initially.
      Returns:
      all meters in a group

    • updateMeters

      public void updateMeters​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> effects)
      Updates the feeling meters based on the effects given. The effects come from a screen and have three first letters of the emotion in question as indicators followed by how much that emotion should change.
      Parameters:
      effects - effects on feeling meters

    • getStrongestEmotion

      public java.lang.String getStrongestEmotion()
      Returns the emotion with the most full meter.
      Returns:
      emotion with the most full meter

    • getEmotions

      public java.lang.String[] getEmotions()
      Returns the list of all emotions.
      Returns:
      list of all emotions in English

    • createFeelingMeterButton

      public com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Button createFeelingMeterButton()
      Creates the button to show the feeling meters. Turns off if the settings button is pressed.
      Returns:
      button to show feeling meters

    • createSettingsButton

      public com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Button createSettingsButton()
      Creates the button to show settings. Turns off if the feeling meter button is pressed.
      Returns:
      button to show settings

    • createSettings

      public com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group createSettings()
      Creates the buttons that control music and sound.
      Returns:
      group of buttons that control music and sound

    • getMeter

      public FeelingMeter getMeter​(java.lang.String emotion)
      Returns a specific feeling meter based on the name given.
      Parameters:
      emotion - name of the meter
      Returns:
      the meter

    • hideMeters

      public void hideMeters()
      Fades out all meters. Also makes them the back most item of their screen.

    • showMeters

      public void showMeters()
      Fades in all meters. Also makes them the fore most item of their screen.

    • showSettings

      public void showSettings()
      Fades out all settings. Also makes them the back most item of their screen.

    • hideSettings

      public void hideSettings()
      Fades in all settings. Also makes them the fore most item of their screen.

    • showScreenElements

      public void showScreenElements​(Screen thisScreen)
      Fades in all elements from the given screen's elements group. Unpauses the answers on the screen and makes the background the light variant. Also makes them the fore most item of their screen.
      Parameters:
      thisScreen - the screen to show the elements in

    • hideScreenElements

      public void hideScreenElements​(Screen thisScreen)
      Fades out all elements from the given screen's elements group. Pauses the answers on the screen. Also makes them the back most item of their screen.
      Parameters:
      thisScreen - the screen to hide the elements in
